DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate safety effectiveness ZM900 Tecnis Multifocal lens . Results two study ( original study 125 multifocal 123 monofocal subject , protocol DIOL-101-TCNS , expansion study 222 additional multifocal subject , protocol DIOL-104-TCNS ) combine evaluate ZM900 Tecnis Multifocal lens vs. monofocal control . The original study conduct 2004-2006 ; expansion study conduct 2007-2008 . Results study analyze together FDA approval .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Effectiveness Multifocal Intraocular Lens ( IOL )
DOC.detailed_description: The original study protocol DIOL-101-TCNS ; expansion study protocol DIOL-104-TCNS . The study protocols almost identical exception control subject enrol expansion study ; additional multifocal subject . All eligibility criterion test conducted expansion study original study . The hypothesis best correct distance visual acuity ZM900 lens would meet exceed FDA grid value , complication adverse event rate ZM900 would similar FDA grid rate posterior chamber IOLs , near visual acuity ZM900 lens would improve compare monofocal control lens .
DOC.criteria: Visual potential 20/30 good study eye Preoperative BCDVA bad Snellen 20/40 bad 20/30 presence glare ( measure use Snellen chart BAT medium ) Naturally dilate pupil size ( dim light ) > 4.0 mm ( dilation medication ) study eye Preoperative corneal astigmatism 1.0 D less Use systemic ocular medication may affect vision ( use miotic agent specifically contraindicate ) Acute chronic disease illness would increase operative risk confound study outcome ( ) , ( e.g. , diabetes mellitus , immunocompromised , connective tissue disease , etc . ) Uncontrolled systemic ocular disease History ocular trauma prior ocular surgery subject expect require retinal laser treatment surgical intervention Presence ocular pathology cataract : Amblyopia strabismus Corneal abnormality Pupil abnormality Capsule zonule abnormality Intraocular inflammation Known pathology may affect visual acuity and/or predict cause future acuity loss level 20/30 worse ( e.g . macular degeneration ) Requiring intraocular lens outside study diopter range Contact lens usage prior study procedure ( time interval dependent upon contact lens type )
